Key Arguments: Censorship should be limited and agreed upon by society.
Dissenting opinions towards government ideology or policies should be allowed.
Definitions of misinformation and disinformation are difficult due to the rapidly changing information landscape.
Harm definitions should not be made by those with vested interests.
Legislation poses severe risks to the community.
Main Themes: Challenges in defining misinformation and disinformation
Notable Quotes: The termination of free speech never augurs well for a vibrant and democratic society.
Precise definitions of misinformation and disinformation are almost impossible to make due to perpetual and rapid changes in the information landscape.
The risks of the passage of this legislation to the community are severe and the legislation should not be passed.
